docs.title: NixOS Thaiger Sprint 2024
docs.text:
What

A week of intense hacking on Nix in Thailand.

When 15/02/2024 - 22/02/2024 (Thu - Thu) Where Chiang Mai, Thailand Who ~20 developers.

docs.title: 📍 Location
docs.text: Chiang Mai, Thailand

docs.title: 🏘️ Accommodation
docs.text:
Once you are approved participant for the sprint, we'll get everyone to a shared communication room to help organize accommodation.

Note that the accommodation is not covered by the sprint budget.

docs.title: 🍲 Food
docs.text:
We'll organize catering (breakfast and lunch) during the sprint, which is paid by the sponsors.

There are a ton of options for dinners in nearby restaurants.

docs.title: 🔥 Registration
docs.text: Registration closed. You'll be notified soon if you're part of the sprint.

docs.title: 🧵 Topics
docs.text: To be determined once registration closes based on attendees interest.

docs.title: Quickest
docs.text: For people coming from outside Asia, the quickest way to get to Chiang Mai is by plane, usually with layover in Bangkok.

docs.title: Cost Efficient
docs.text:
Domestic flights in Thailand are relatively inexpensive, starting from as low as 25$.

Therefore it might be cheaper to just book a flight to Bangkok and then continue to Chiang Mai via a separate domestic flight, or via the night train which is a nice experience for many travelers.

docs.title: 🥳 Stuff to do in Chiang Mai
docs.text:
• Thai Cooking Lessons
  • Night Markets
  • Temples
  • Mountain Biking
  • Jungle Trekking
  • Elephant Sanctuary
  • Yoga
  • Thai Boxing training session
  • Watch Thai Boxing Fight
  • Thai Massage
  • Rafting
  • Waterfalls
  • ATV
  • Water Parks
  • Guided city tour
  • Karaoke

docs.title: 💙 Sponsors
docs.text:
We're looking for sponsors to cover expenses such as venue, catering, T-shirt printing and some of the activities.

Please help us make this a productive event by chipping in, so we can focus on coding instead of grocery shopping and cooking.

Our target budget is 10000 EUR. Reach out to sponsors@thaigersprint.org.

Level Contribution (EUR) Perks Gold 4000 Company + Large logo on the T-shirt, 2 total reserved seats, shoutout during dinner, SWAG. Company 1500 Individual + Logo on the T-shirt, company name on name tag + 1 reserved seat. Individual 500 Logo on the website.

docs.title: NixOS Ocean Sprint 2021
docs.text:
What A week of intense hacking on Nix near the ocean. When 06/12/2021 - 10/12/2021 (Mon - Fri) Where Villa with FTTH on Lanzarote, Canary Islands Who ~15 developers

Table Of Contents

Eight years after the last Zidanca Sprint, we're back! Watch video recap for some highlights 😻

docs.title: Location
docs.text:
Costa Tequise, Lanzarote

The sprint will take place outside under pavilion tents (for sunshine protection) in a villa with a pool.

Withing a 5 minute walk you can reach:

  • one of the best beaches in Lanzarote, where you can swim, jog, snorkel, SUP, surf and windsurf,
  • a local supermarket that is open every day from 8AM to 10PM,
  • a pharmacy and a bakery,
  • 5km long beachside promenade with free outside gyms,
  • a steakhouse, a burger joint and an authentic Spanish tapas tavern,
  • an assortment of other various cafes, pubs and bars, restaurants, etc.

docs.title: Accommodation
docs.text:
Once you are registered for the sprint, we'll get everyone the location of the villa and local contacts to organize the booking of nearby villas that cost ~200 EUR per person per week.

If you are planning to come with your family and/or stay longer, @Nejc Zupan has written a remote worker's guide to Lanzarote.

docs.title: Food
docs.text:
We'll organize catering (breakfast and lunch) during the sprint.

There are a ton of options for dinners in nearby restaurants.

docs.title: Registration
docs.text: Closed, as we have reached our limit. We hope in the future there will be more of these events!

docs.title: Topics
docs.text: To be determined once registration closes based on attendees interest.

docs.title: Travel
docs.text: The best way to travel is via a plane to Lanzarote airport. It's also possible to fly to other island airports and then take a ferry (Fuertaventura is closest being 30min away).

docs.title: Stuff to do on Lanzarote
docs.text:
• First-class surfing location with verified instructors
  • Kitesurfing and windsurfing
  • Paragliding
  • Visiting the Timanfaya vulcano and eating fish grilled on lava
  • Cycling and mountain biking
  • Vulcano hiking
  • Culture
  • Gastronomy
  • Sailing
  • Cave sightseeing

docs.title: Sponsoring
docs.text:
We're looking for sponsors to cover expenses such as venue, catering, pavilion tents rental, T-shirt printing, LTE access points for backup. Please help us make this a productive event by chipping in, so we can focus on coding instead of grocery shopping and cooking. Our target budget is 5000 EUR. Reach out to sponsors@oceansprint.org.

Sponsor levels

docs.text: Serokell is an international R&D company that specializes in PLT, protocols, biotech and machine learning

docs.title: COVID-19
docs.text:
It's highly recommended that you vaccinate before coming to the sprint.

We will be staying outside most of the time. We'll be renting a pavilion tent for protection against the sun and the unfortunate droplet of rain.

The temperature drops to a minimum of 15 C outside during the night so it's possible to have windows open.

Spain takes the pandemic very seriously, make sure to check up to date requirements before traveling.

September update

docs.title: Sprint Accommodation
docs.text: The recommendations below are based on our personal experience. There are also plenty of options on AirBnb and Booking.com.

docs.title: Senator residence
docs.text:
5 mins walk to the villa. Recently renovated apartment complex with good facilities including kitchen with a dishwasher, a washing machine, and a terrace. There is a chilly shared pool with sun beds, surrounded by a small well maintained garden. The complex is a bit remote from the downtown and the beach (15-20 mins walk) so it has quiet, relaxed vibe. The sunsets are amazing in Senator!

  • White Suite Deluxe
  • Canaryislandshost l Arena Beach
  • Marina Senator
  • Luxury Senator Apartments
  • Lanzarote Blue Senator
  • Castillo de Luz
  • Senator Isla de Lobos 2
  • Apartamento Aguamarina Senator
  • The Ocean View Senator modern apartment

docs.title: Apartamentos El Guarapo
docs.text:
12 mins walk to the villa. The apartments facilities are basic, all have a small kitchen and a balcony (or terrace), and washing machines are shared in the common area. There is a nice bar onsite offering good food and drinks, but it is open only till afternoon. The swimming pool is usually packed and not that inviting. The complex is close to a small beach and a picturesque promenade along the shore. Be sure to book an upper floor apartment.

  • Apartamentos El Guarapo

docs.title: Hotel *Oasis Lanz Beach Mate*
docs.text:
12 mins walk to the villa. The location of the hotel is a few steps to the beach and the downtown with multiple bars and restaurants. The hotel is beautifully designed and modern with a nice pool and a bar on site. Keep in mind that this is a hotel and its standard rooms don’t have a kitchen or a washing machine.

  • Oasis Lanz Beach Mate

docs.title: Hotel *Barceló Teguise Beach - Adults Only*
docs.text:
15 mins walk to the villa. It’s a high quality beautiful package hotel, very close to the beach and the downtown, has a lot of various facilities typical for package hotels.

  • Barceló Teguise Beach - Adults Only

docs.title: *H10 Suites Lanzarote Gardens*
docs.text:
8 mins to the villa and across the road to the main beach of Costa Teguise. The hotel is only recommended If you’re coming with kids. Not a good choice otherwise, as the hotel is focused on activities for kids, and there is non-stop multi-stream animation throughout the day and loud music in the evenings.

  • H10 Suites Lanzarote Gardens

Some of the places we don’t recommend (based on our experience)

  • Apartment Golden and apartment Golden 2. The apartments are remote, with old facilities and the neighbourhood is not so nice.
  • Teguisol complex. A lot of construction on site and too far away from the downtown and the villa. However, you may find cost-effective options there.

docs.title: Wine tasting - 35€
docs.text:
We get picked up by bus and we dive deeper into the unique style of how wine is produced on Lanzarote.

Choose four of your favourite styles from a portfolio of wines.

A bite of artisanal cheese and charcuterie will accompany your personalized tasting. The experience takes about 60 minutes.

docs.title: Vulcano hike - free
docs.text:
A classic of Ocean Sprint. We leave the venue on foot for a 1.5h hike to the nearest vulcano with great views over the nearby tows and coastline.

Beginner-friendly.

docs.title: Intro to surfing - 30€
docs.text:
Pickup by vans at the sprint venue and leave for Famara, the surfing mecca of Lanzarote. Two hours in the water with rented surfboard, wetsuits and surf coaching. Back by dinner.

Beginner-friendly.

docs.title: Bonfire Night in the Desert - free
docs.text:
A night under the stars with a bonfire in the middle of a vulcano.

We'll go for dinner near the venue, then organize the transportation and each participants brings their own drinks&snacks.

docs.title: Drumming - free
docs.text:
We'd like to offer you a group drumming session on-site on Monday or Tuesday with Karina, the drummer from The 3 Bridies.

The idea: an instrument for everybody, whether they know how to play it or not and we have 30min of fun under the guidance of Karina.

Originally from Argentina, Karina is our percussionist, playing congas and cajon, along with a variety of other percussion instruments in our live gigs, including, cymbals, chimes and rain stick among others. Karina is a teacher of percussion and a serial collector of percussion instruments, she brings a great flavour to our folk music.

docs.title: Sailing with catamaran - 50€
docs.text: Enjoy the ocean vibes and scenic views during a few hour catamaran excursion at sunset with drinks and tapas.

docs.title: The Morning Dip - free
docs.text: Meet at venue at 8AM, walk down to the beach for a quick swim, be back by 9AM breakfast time.

docs.title: Yoga - free
docs.text: Depending on the interest, a yoga teacher could come to the venue or we would go to the beach to strech.

docs.title: Diving - ~100€
docs.text:
On October 7, 1993, Lanzarote was granted the prestigious status of a Biosphere Reserve by UNESCO, making it the second Biosphere Reserve in the Canary Islands.

We invite you to embark on a journey of exploration and discovery as we delve into the remarkable underwater world of this biosphere. Lanzarote’s dive sites offer a unique opportunity to witness the diverse marine ecosystems that thrive in this protected area. From vibrant coral reefs to fascinating volcanic formations, each dive site holds its own charm and surprises.

Together, we can uncover the hidden treasures beneath the surface, encountering an abundance of marine life and experiencing the awe-inspiring beauty of Lanzarote’s biosphere. Join us in exploring these remarkable dive sites and witness firsthand the wonders that make this island a designated UNESCO Biosphere Reserve.

We can organize try dives for those who have not dived before as well as guided dives for already certified divers. For those coming early and/or staying longer it is also an option to make dive certificates.

docs.title: Bouldering - 12€
docs.text: We get picked up by vans and go to a bouldering gym and stretch those fingers.

docs.title: Submarine Excursion - 56€
docs.text:
A proper submarine experience that goes down to 30 meters, a geeky adventure underwater.

Bus transport is provided by the submarine company.

docs.title: eMTB trip - 50€
docs.text:
A 3-hour electric mountain-bike trip to the top of Lanzarote, with amazing 360-degrees views followed by a 400 vertical-meters singletrack descent back to the sprint venue. @zupo's favorite after-work trail. Bikes rented from a nearby shop.

Experience needed.

docs.title: e-bike trip - 40€
docs.text:
A 3 hour e-bike tour along the coastal pathway from Costa Teguise, through Arrecife, the capital of Lanzarote, past the airport to Puerto del Carmen, and back.

Beginner-friendly.

docs.title: Intro to Wing-foiling - 80€
docs.text:
Walk down to the beach and do a 1.5-hour intro lesson to the new sport of Wing-foiling at the local school.

Beginner friendly.

docs.title: Intro to Windsurfing - 45€
docs.text:
Walk down to the beach and do a 1.5-hour intro lesson to the new sport of Windsurfing at the local school.

Beginner friendly.

docs.title: Dawn patrol - free
docs.text:
Beat the crowds and experience pure Lanzarote surfing by joining @zupo/@domenkozar at locals-only spots around the island, while watching the Sun rise over the horizon.

Experience needed.

docs.title: Go-kart Gran Prix - 50€
docs.text: We get picked up by a bus and we do a private gran prix of 30 km of race in 23 laps.
